intro: Erigeron peregrinus var. eucallianthemus, commonly known as the Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes, thriving in full sun. Its foliage is usually gray-green with woolly hairs, and it produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white to pale yellow. The species is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ability to support local pollinators.
